intro: Galium seatonii, commonly known as Seaton's bedstraw, is a low-growing perennial herb native to the United Kingdom. It typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters and features slender, wiry stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, oval-shaped, and have a slightly hairy texture. Galium seatonii thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
